page.title: 18Police Station. Church.
page.content:
POLICE The police station is in Manse Road, just down from the school. It is about 80 years old. In the station is an office and two cells.The cells are only used by criminals overnight. For longer stays they are transferred to Dumfries Police Station. Six men work at the station with the sergeant in charge. There are two police vehicles. When dogs are needed they are brought from Dumfries.
CHURCH Thornhill church stands behind the school on the Station Road.In 1976 Thornhill Parish Church joined up with all the other churches in the area of Thornhill and is now known as Thornhill Parish and Congregational Churches.
